title: Fast, easy and the loan parameters I was looking for.
content: I've taken out a few personal loans over the years and this experience was surprisingly straightforward and quickly handled.  I started my application with a representative over the phone, which was followed the next day by an approval notice and brief conversation to go over the details with the loan officer.  I electronically signed the docs from a link in my email.  I got the funds directly deposited the next day.  Great interest rate, no pre-pay penalty, direct deposit setup out of the gate.  Couldn't be happier.

Will look elsewhere!

title: Glad that I did some online bill consolidation research
content: So, I needed to do another bill consolidation since my bills were getting a little out of hand. Things happen in life where you sometimes have no control over. So ironically, I got something in the mail from another company, but I then decided to go online to find the most reputable loan company and found Lending Tree. They gave links to various banks and then, I saw what First Midwest Bank was offering and pursued. I felt the process was fairly painless, even though my previous loan was easier. However, this loan provided to me was almost half the interest of the other service. So, I would rather deal with a few more hoops and hurdles and get a lower rate than going through a walk in the park and get a higher interest rate. All in all, I was very pleased with the entire process.

title: The rate that I was offered through lending tree was significantly less that 1stMidwest
content: The lendingtree website showed a rate and when I applied through First Midwest, it came back with a rate that was 2% higher. I asked Jessica at First Midwest why the rate was so different and she informed me that "Lending tree does a soft pull of your credit and they give you rates based on that. The rate they assumed you to be at was 800 or above FICO score which is why that rate came up for us. That rate is available, however, your credit has to be at 800 or above."  My credit score is 767 and Lendingtree has access to that credit score. Through Lendingtree, I selected "Very Good = between 740-799" for my credit score. Why would they "assume" that my credit score is 800 especially since only 20% of Americans have a credit score of 800 or above.

title: A Great Experience with an Unusual Situation.
content: I contacted LendingTree and First Midwest Bank was one of the first institutions to respond. I had done business with them in the past. I had been looking for a personal loan to help with a business I am starting with a friend en Medellin Colombia, which is why the situation was unusual. I retired at the end of December and went to Medellin on a three year Visa for Retirees. I was not planning on starting a business. I have a young psychologist friend here who I have known for four years. She is quite intelligent and has a gift for working with kids. She outlined a plan to work with kids here to teach them Social Emotional Learning through music and art. I decided that it would be better to limit the number of outside investors and better to retain most of the control of the business. Because I was out of the country, there were many challenges to even getting the approval for the loan. I had a credit score in the 800's, but no assets since I sold everything when I moved here. I maintain a permanent address in the US. Simple things like calling to confirm my information became very complicated. My loan specialist, Jasmine, was with me every step of the way with what seemed like an incredible amount of patience with my seemingly endless questions that basically had the theme "how am I going to do this". We her help, we got it done. I am not sure how many other companies or their employees would have done the same. I highly recommend them and Jasmine.

If you have a problem with providing proof, please go elsewhere as they take their role as a lender seriously and are professionals. title: Misleading Rate and Poor Customer Service
content: I don't typically write reviews, but I felt that this would be one that I needed to write. I was looking for a debt consolidation loan and received several offers from Midwest at incredibly loan APRs here on Lending Tree. Obviously thinking that I was about to get a great deal, I very quickly applied for a loan. The first red flag was the fact that the loan approval wasn't instant. With the other loan companies that I have used in the past for personal loans, it's never taken more than a couple of minutes to receive a decision. At Midwest, I was informed they were working on it, and to expect a phone call later in the day with their decision. That afternoon I got a phone call informing me that my application had been denied, even though the referral from Lending Tree made it seem like the chances of approval were high. I have a 750  credit score, so I asked why I had been denied. They explained it was because my debt-to-income ratio was too high; I was applying for a debt consolidation loan after all. So even though they advertised an amazing rate on Lending Tree, I ended up with no loan and a hard pull on my credit.

When I received the docusign, my band information was not present, and they got my husbands email wrong, meaning they sent my docusign with my confidential information (including my bank info) to the wrong person. Outside of that logistical error, the website is outdated, and the loan application was slow to process.

title: Great Experience!
content: It is never an easy decision to borrow money; however, my investment person told me it's best to get a personal loan for my home improvement projects than to pay taxes!  So I went to Lending Tree and First Midwest Bank popped up on my list with a 5-star rating.  I took at look at their website and read the reviews.  I received several calls from them that I did not answer (I don't answer unknown phone numbers) and a few emails.  They were quick in reaching out, but not aggressive which I liked.  I decided to contact them.  I called and spoke with Patrick.  He gave me good information to think about.  I then decided to apply.  The process was easy, had my answer the next day and my money by weeks end.  Another plus is my monthly payment will automatically be taken out of my account.  I can then pay extra on the principal without penalty of paying it off early.  Through the process, I spoke with Patrick, MJ and Chrissy ~ all very friendly and knowledgeable.  If you are trying to decide which bank to trust, I would recommend First Midwest Bank.

title: Easy application process with Outstanding customer service!
content: Applying for a loan to consolidate my debt with First Midwest Bank was incredibly easy! I struggled with some online questions, so I ended up applying over the phone. I highly recommend that route. My agent, Cassie was kind, patient, knowledgeable and thorough. She listened to my needs, answered every question and kept me on track when I got distracted. I wasn’t approved for the amount I had asked, but in the end, it was to my benefit. It felt like they were looking out for my best interest throughout the entire process. I have NEVER experienced such fast and friendly customer service! Cassie responded to my emails as if she was sitting there waiting for my correspondence. This was a truly amazing experience! With everything going on in the world, this company has helped me and my family better cope with financial hardship and alleviated a lot of stress. I am truly grateful! Thank you!

author: Maegan

title: Bait and switch tactics
content: After using the LendingTree app for the first time to see my options for what would be available for personal loans, I received about a dozen offers from several different companies.  First Midwest Bank offered the best term personal loan and I immediately received phone calls, emails and texts from them asking me to submit an application.  I took a chance and decided to do so, totally assuming that I would be approved for the loan since my credit score is 750 , in my opinion is impeccable and they gave every indication that I would be approved.  A day after I submitted the application I found out they declined me due to some kind of debt ratio related reasons (still not clear to me).  Now I have a hard inquiry on my credit report for two years.  I consider this bait and switch tactics on their end, just to trick more customers into submitting an application.  I'll be sure to warn others against doing business with First Midwest Bank, and this didn't leave a good impression on me with LendingTree itself.

title: I've never been spoken to so rudely
content: Wow, is all I an say. I've never been treated so rudely by a company. I never write negative reviews for companies, however TeAnna at 1st Midwest Bank takes the cake. I received an email from my personal banker saying my loan request had a decision with a note to call him. When I called, TeAnna said "he's busy, what do you need?" Her tone indicated that she was annoyed with the call. After looking up my loan and providing the information, I began to inquire more and she interrupted me every time. I then asked to be put on the do not call list for their company and she said they couldn't do it. When I said that by law, they have to do it, she said "ok, we'll take care of it" rushing me off the phone.  I sincerely hope you do TeAnna. Please be nicer to future customers(fortunately, I will not be one of them). Also, if you hate people, please get out of customer service.

author: kerry

title: The finest service I have recieved from a bank in 50 years!
content: I was looking for a personal loan to remodel my home, at first I was going to use a credit card to pay for the remodel. At 8:00 PM that night I decided to try and get a loan for the remodel, I looked up banks and couldn't make up my mind which bank to select so I went to the Lending Tree web site for a referral to quality lending institutions. I found First  Midwest Bank and begin to fill out the application. The next morning I received a phone call from Marcela Escutia, direct Sales Banker asking me a few questions about my application, she told me she would give the application to the underwriters for approval and get back to me and within 2 hours Marcela phoned me back and told me I was approved. She emailed me the documents to sign and told me if I completed and returned the documents before today the money would be in my bank the next business day, And it was there the next business day. I would like to personally thank Marcela Esutia for the chance to do business with her and First Midwest Bank. The service, ease of filling out the application,  the response time for my loan was unequivocally the finest banking institution I have done business with in over 50 years. If there a 10-star rating I would without a doubt rate them a 10.

title: Christine Ruiz was wonderful
content: Getting my debt under control was extremely overwhelming as it seemed like the credit card companies were ruining my life. I had been worrying about my debt for so long that when I finally came to a breaking point I felt extremely hopeless, scared, and not sure where to turn. After some research and advice from family, I came to Lending Tree to get estimates from different banks to help find someone who could give me a debt consolidation loan. First Midwest Bank came up as the bank with the best rates for me and they reached out to me by email. Christine at First Midwest Bank was there for me from my beginning questions to the closing a few days later. Having one person helping through the entire process helped build trust and I felt like finally I wasn't alone against the credit cards companies. I'm extremely excited to be taking my life back and I feel lucky that the bank I was matched with was First Midwest.

title: Very stressful loan application process
content: I applied for a personal loan for $12,000 with my dad as a cosigner, since FMB is one of the few banks that allow this. During the loan application process, my loan was denied twice via email, both times with barely any explanation as to why. The first time the girl who was helping me sent an email informing me of the denial at the very end of the day and then was out of the office so I had to call the phone number for them to tell me that it was denied due to them having me as Part-Time even though on the loan application, I put that I work Full-Time. Then was denied again and called in to find out it was due to them needing additional paperwork. Why they sent me a denial instead of just request the additional paperwork is beyond me. They also needed information on a credit card, yet could only give me the last 4 digits, so I took an entire lunch break online trying to figure out which card it is, only for them to tell me it's my dad's and not mine when I told them I could not find it.  I ended up having to submit a total of 10  documents to them via email and a full 3 weeks after submitting the original application, the loan was approved. Finally, I had stated via email TWICE that I wanted to be set up with auto-debit, yet no auto-debit for payments was set up. Overall, this was a very stressful loan application process but they do have the lowest interest rates that I found.

author: Craig

title: A truly great AND easy experience from start to finish
content: We were looking to pay off about 19K in total credit card debt between my wife and I's accounts and have only 1 monthly payment to make on the debt. I decided to go with the Lending Tree network as they are one of the oldest, most trusted online personal lenders around and have seemingly hundreds of online banking partners. We decided to apply with their partner First Midwest Bank, as they have almost 2000 reviews at close to  a 5 star average score, and very good sample rates as well. We were assigned loan offices Jasmine Vargas, and the entire process was simple and easy and took less than week to complete from start to finish, and that included playing some phone tag initially. I cannot recommend Lending Tree or their partner First Midwest any higher, and would like to let anyone considering an online personal loan know that First Midwest is definitely the way to go. If you can, please request to deal with Jasmine Vargas as she is OUTSTANDING to work with.

I find this to be dishonest.  I've received loans from other companies and the final rate matched the advertised offer.

So I took a loan for $10,000 @ $6.99% interest, paid off the small debts, so I can allocate my funds to the Home Depot debt. It was so easy. I did it on my phone,  online, in less than 10 min. I called and spoke with someone to ensure it was ligit. Within 2 business days I had my funds. The only downside is that you can't make online payments. Needless to say, TeAnna Jones was very helpful and I'm very satisfied.

content: From the first moment I applied to the time the money went into my account, I don't think 3 business days went by.  Simple process and they communicated with me throughout the process.  I will advise that the rate you see on the website is for those with "perfect credit and debt to income ratio".  Most of the public will not receive the advertised rate as it very much is bout your credit score and current debt.  For example, I applied to the advertised 6.99% rate however I received a 7.99% rate (still not bad) and my FICO score is well over 800 but I am close to 50% debt to income ratio.  Keep that in mind when applying but I wouldn't hesitate to do business with them again.  Best rated lender on Lending Tree.

I just feel like that information was given to me right after I was told out loan was approved not right before I applied. Cassie was helpful and answered all my questions and was very pleasant. title: Personal Loan request
content: I was looking for a personal loan to consolidate some credit card debt. I checked a number of resources before I checked 1st Midwest because I assumed that a bank (I work for one) would drag the process along with unnecessary documentation requirements.  I remember the “too big to fail” bank attitudes that caused hardship for many families.  However, after checking the better business rating for 1st Midwest, I decided to give them a try. I can honestly say that I did not encounter ANY of the issues that I expected.  Patrick Offerman, the bank representative that I worked with was very patient and informed.  He responded to my e-mails and phone calls in a timely manner.  The fixed rate that I was offered was GREAT.  The fixed rate that 1st Midwest approved me for is more that 10% less than one of  my credit card which saves me hundreds of dollars over the life of the loan. They have really good re-payment plans also.  This loan took a lot of weight off of me, I felt wonderful after receiving the approval, the rate and monthly payment amount.  This loan gave me back a sense of control over my finances.  I am a walking advertisement for 1st Midwest and would highly recommend them to my family, my friends or anyone who is seeking release from the burden(s) of credit card debt with their ever increasing rates or other expenses that may be encountered in life’s unpredictable circumstances.  A+ to First Midwest and Patrick Offerman:) They have a lifetime customer.

I've dealt with companies who directly sent the money to me and was able to pay it off in the next 2 or 3 days which wasn't the case here. I ended up having to send my payment to the original company. I ended up getting a reimbursement but that could have been prevented in the first place had First Midwest Bank been a little quicker with sending the money to them. title: outstanding
content: all around excellent experience, quick easy no hidden fees and very professional experience
author: eugene

title: Lowest Rates Great Customer Service
content: I have a very good credit score, but I wanted to clean up some credit card debt with a personal loan.  When I compared loans with Lending Tree, I initially thought the interest First Midwest offered was a bait and switch teaser rate.  Not so.  The final rate offered was what they initially quoted and almost half of other lenders.  Surprisingly, it is just a fraction of a percent higher than my recent HELOC.  The entire process from initial contact to funding was less than 48 hours.  My loan officer Christine was easy to contact and very helpful.  If I require additional funding in the future I will absolutely contact First Midwest Bank.
author: Mark

title: Great
content: Fast and great service, Thank you Karen
author: Jerome

title: Loan Process Satisfaction
content: After visiting the Lending Tree website, First Midwest Bank was the first responder to our inquiry. Cassie was the Loan Representative that we worked with during most of the loan process. Everyone else we dealt with was as equally helpful. Our entire loan processing took 5 business days and we were completely satisfied with the entire process. I would recommend First Midwest Bank to anyone wanting a loan.
author: Debbie

title: Personal Loan Review
content: I was working with TeAnna Jones who was very prompt in her responses to me. I appreciate the quickness and attention to detail.
author: Michele

title: Kelly
content: Good customer service and when I couldn't contact them by phone because of my hours they let me contact through email.  They made my loan process simple and easy to understand and explained everything to me so I had no question.  Would recommend them to anyone.
author: Kelly

title: Great Customer Service
content: The application process was smooth and the communication from my First Midwest Bank (FMB) representative (Kristina G.) was excellent. I racked up a fair amount of credit card debt and FMB provided me a way of consolidating it into a much lower interest rate than I was dealing with. Kristina provided very clear communication and was able to quickly answer the few questions i had. Overall it was a positive experience and I would use FMB in the future if need be.
author: Andrew

title: Credit card consolidation loan
content: Cassie made the entire process comfortable, easy and smooth.  She was always responsive to my questions, returned my calls quickly and was very comfortable to work with.
author: Andrew

title: Loan Review
content: I needed a loan, and First Midwest gave me the best offer, and got it done right away.
author: Kevin

title: Speedy & Painless loan process
content: The service & process of my application and loan approval was very quick & painless on my half. The customer service of Cassie & Mandy was excellent. I was very pleased with how speedy they processed my loan & how polite they were every time I spoke to or emailed with them.
author: Jenna

title: wow what drive
content: Christine was wonderful full of spunk professional fast efficient and down right awesome thank you again for the extra ordinary service!
author: Adam

title: Fast and simple
content: Just closed our loan a few days after application .. process was quick
author: Ashley

title: Straight forward assistance
content: All of my questions and concerns were addressed by exceptionally friendly and experienced representatives. Jasmine Vargas assisted us through every step of the process until finished.
author: Christine

title: Great customer service
content: First Midwest was very helpful getting my loan approved
author: Josh

title: The Midwest Experience
content: Went above an beyond to help with the process of the loan always friendly and would defiantly recommend them to a family member or friend
author: Pamela

title: First Midwest Bank - personal loan
content: All personnel were very professional and helpful. Information was processed quickly. The interest rate was below all other lenders. Everything was handled easily on line. Highly recommended.
author: John

title: VeryPleased
content: Midwest was ready when I was ready. No Pressure, yet quick and simple
author: Brian

title: Great Communication!
content: I received multiple updates from Cassie and we start to finish it took a few days. Then once the paperwork was signed it was funded in less than 24 hours! The whole experience was a pleasure with absolutely no hassles.
author: Linda

title: Great Company!
content: Very easy process. The people that work at this company are very helpful.
author: Micahel

title: loan
content: The whole process was quick and easy. From application to the funds being in my account was 2 days.
author: Jennifer

title: Excellent
content: Great experience,  customer service and rates. Highly recommend.
author: Donald

title: Excellent Service
content: Max did a great job.  He was very responsive and helped me get approved quick!
author: Jordan

title: Great service
content: Would definitely recommend getting a loan with first Midwest, they made it very easy & were really nice & helpful.
author: Maria

title: Great
content: It was a great experience doing business with Midwest Bank, customer service is excellent and the transaction was fast.
author: Kelsang

title: Easy and Quick
content: Easy and Quick. TeAnna's customer service skills-SUPERB!
author: Sheila

title: Midwest brings momentum to finance.
content: First Midwest Bank exceeded my expectations with the lending process.  There customer service was friendly and informative.
author: Clinton

title: Earned a loyal customer
content: Maximilian Ortiz was professional throughout the whole process. He explained the process every step of the way. The whole process was quick, easy and almost effortless on my part. Midwest Bank exceeded my expectations and I would definitely recommend them to family and friends.
author: Rosa

title: Great customer service
content: I had an excellent experience with Midwest Bank and their loan staffers.
author: jerome

title: Refinanced Personal Loan
content: My experience with First Midwest Bank was great, Max was in constant contact with me keeping me informed of where we were at in the process. The entire process was quick and simple, Id recommend their services to anyone. The rate I received was amazing, cutting my payment by almost 23%.
author: Harry

title: Great service
content: Liliana was great to work with. The whole process was very quick and easy, start to finish.
author: Sharon

title: Stellar customer service experience
content: I not only want to leave the best review possible, but also thank Kristina Greary and staff for the excellent customer service and patience. Their responses are very fast and so very happy with this institution!
author: Debra

title: Kept on schedule
content: Cassie Navarrete was a great help in making this a smooth process. Thanks to Mandy as well. Even when I had a correction to do, Cassie got the information needed from me and resubmitted the app, everything taken care of quickly and efficiently. Thanks to everyone at First Midwest Bank.
author: Keith

title: A great review
content: Fast and easy !  I was walked through the process with all questions answered professionally and courteously. Mr. Offerman was just great !  I can't thank him enough for his expertise and patience in answering my every question.
author: Noel

title: Great Service and Very Good Rates
content: I am happy to have worked with Liliana Ornelas.  She was always on top of everything.  She was super helpful and I am super grateful.  I am glad that I was able to get a better loan interest rate through First Midwest.
author: Cason

title: Very Happy Customer
content: I am so happy that I received on offer from First Midwest Bank on lending Tree. I wasnt sure if the rate was good or not. I went to my bank to compare rates and FMB totally blew away my own bank by about 5%. I rushed home to accept the offer .It was approved and closed in less than a week. The money was in my account. I paid a very small fee for the origination fee and was on my way to doing much needed repairs on my home. Thank you so much for being so consumer friendly. The agents i talked with were very polite and professional. The process couldnt have been better. It was just a matter of emailing some information and signing the documents. Very pleased with the entire process from start to finish. Thank You FMB.
author: Veronica

title: Good vibes at a great rate
content: Cynthia is the kind of person you'd like to cultivate in your life. Pleasant, responsive, compassionate, understanding, and  just down right hard working.  As soon as we began, I had nothing but the best vibes which to me is extremely important when conducting any type of business. It's the very first thing we remember as customers and shoppers and what keeps us coming back for more. Every email was met with direct response to my questions and very clear direction of how things were going. We spoke through email and phone and yes my application could of been done faster but that was only due in part because of my odd working hours so when we contacted each other through email it was very attentive and very responsive and friendly. I always appreciate working with someone you don't know but feel like you've been friends for a while.
author: james

title: Five Stars For Sure!!!!!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
content: Top notch customer service. Sonia Gil was our account rep and she was extremely attentive and helpful every step of the process. Kathy was also helpful when Sonia wasn’t available. The whole process was simple and streamlined. Excellent.
author: John

title: Review
content: Excellent customer service, simple process!
author: casey

title: Great!
content: They were quick and gave me a great rate.
author: Andrew

title: Great Service
content: Received several loan options from lending tree, but First Midwest Bank had the best terms. Applied for the loan in the morning, was approved later that day, closed online the next day then funds were direct deposited the next. Very good experience with First Midwest.
author: G Thomas

title: Excellence in service and fast process
content: Once the required documentation has been submitted the process goes smooth and fast.  Other lenders in the Lending Tree network were either slower to respond or had lending fees and interest rates that were too high.  Some lenders had slightly better interest rates, but when considering the of the speed of the process and the excellence in customer service there is no reason to quibble of less than a half point in interest. and the excellence
author: Roger
